storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my daily schedule to plan my workday effectively

testCases.title: Validate daily schedule display for logged-in employee
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least one shift scheduled for the current day
Web portal is accessible and operational
Backend API GET /api/schedules/daily is functional
Test data is available in EmployeeSchedules table

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page and enter valid employee credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Login is successful and employee dashboard is displayed with navigation menu visible

steps.action: Click on the 'Schedule' section from the navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section opens and displays schedule view options

steps.action: Select 'Daily View' option from the schedule view menu
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule for the current day is displayed with all scheduled shifts visible

steps.action: Verify that the current day is highlighted in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Current day is visually highlighted (e.g., different color or border)

steps.action: Review each shift displayed and note the shift start time, end time, location, and role
steps.expectedResult: Each shift shows complete details: start time, end time, location name, and assigned role

steps.action: Compare displayed shift details with backend data from EmployeeSchedules table for the logged-in employee
steps.expectedResult: All shift times, locations, and roles match exactly with backend database records

steps.action: Verify that the page load time is recorded from navigation to full display
steps.expectedResult: Daily schedule loads and displays completely within 2 seconds

steps.action: Check if active shifts (currently in progress) are highlighted differently
steps.expectedResult: Active shifts are visually distinguished from upcoming or past shifts

postconditions: Employee remains logged in to the system
Daily schedule view remains accessible for further navigation
No errors are logged in the system
Session remains active

testCases.title: Verify navigation between days in daily schedule view
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
Daily schedule view is already displayed
Employee has shifts scheduled on multiple days
At least one day in the range has no scheduled shifts
Navigation buttons (Next Day, Previous Day) are visible

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Next Day' button on the daily schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view refreshes and displays the schedule for the next calendar day

steps.action: Verify the date displayed in the schedule header updates to the next day
steps.expectedResult: Date header shows the correct next day's date

steps.action: Review the shifts displayed for the next day
steps.expectedResult: All shifts scheduled for the next day are displayed with accurate details

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Previous Day' button on the daily schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view refreshes and displays the schedule for the previous calendar day (returning to original day)

steps.action: Verify the date displayed in the schedule header updates to the previous day
steps.expectedResult: Date header shows the correct previous day's date

steps.action: Review the shifts displayed for the previous day
steps.expectedResult: All shifts scheduled for the previous day are displayed with accurate details

steps.action: Navigate to a date that has no scheduled shifts by clicking 'Next Day' or 'Previous Day' multiple times
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view displays the selected date with a clear message 'No shifts scheduled' or similar

steps.action: Verify that the empty schedule view still shows the correct date and navigation buttons remain functional
steps.expectedResult: Date header is correct, no shift data is shown, and navigation buttons are still clickable

steps.action: Verify that each navigation action completes without errors or delays
steps.expectedResult: All navigation transitions occur smoothly within 2 seconds per action

postconditions: Employee remains on the daily schedule view
Navigation buttons remain functional
No system errors are generated
Employee can continue navigating to other dates

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized access is blocked
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist in the system (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A is logged into the web portal
Employee B has scheduled shifts with a known schedule URL
Audit logging is enabled in the system
OAuth2 authentication and RBAC are properly configured

steps.action: While logged in as Employee A, obtain the direct URL for Employee B's daily schedule (e.g., /schedules/daily?employeeId=B)
steps.expectedResult: URL is constructed with Employee B's identifier

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's daily schedule by entering the URL directly in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: System denies access and displays an error message such as 'Access Denied: You are not authorized to view this schedule'

steps.action: Verify that Employee A is redirected back to their own schedule or an error page
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is redirected to their own schedule view or a generic error page, not Employee B's schedule

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data for Employee B is displayed or leaked in the response
steps.expectedResult: No shift details, times, locations, or any data belonging to Employee B is visible

steps.action: Access the system audit log through admin interface or database query
steps.expectedResult: Audit log is accessible and contains recent entries

steps.action: Search the audit log for the unauthorized access attempt by Employee A
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains an entry recording the unauthorized access attempt

steps.action: Verify the audit log entry includes timestamp, Employee A's user ID, attempted resource (Employee B's schedule), and access denied status
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry shows: timestamp of attempt, Employee A's user ID, target resource identifier, and 'Access Denied' or similar status

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's schedule using API endpoint directly (e.g., GET /api/schedules/daily?employeeId=B) with Employee A's authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized status code with appropriate error message

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with access only to their own schedule
Employee B's schedule data remains secure and inaccessible to Employee A
Audit log contains complete record of unauthorized access attempt
System security controls remain intact

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my weekly schedule to plan my workweek efficiently

testCases.title: Validate weekly schedule display with accurate shifts
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has multiple shifts scheduled across the current week
Web portal is accessible and operational
Backend API GET /api/schedules/weekly is functional
Test data is populated in EmployeeSchedules table for the current week

steps.action: Navigate to the web portal login page and enter valid employee credentials
steps.expectedResult: Employee successfully logs in and dashboard is displayed with navigation options

steps.action: Click on the 'Schedule' section from the main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section opens displaying available schedule view options

steps.action: Select 'Weekly View' option from the schedule view menu
steps.expectedResult: Weekly schedule for the current week is displayed showing all seven days

steps.action: Verify that the week start date and week end date are correctly displayed in the header
steps.expectedResult: Week range is shown (e.g., 'Week of Jan 15 - Jan 21, 2024') with correct dates

steps.action: Review the weekly schedule layout and verify all seven days of the week are visible
steps.expectedResult: All days from Monday to Sunday (or Sunday to Saturday based on configuration) are displayed in the weekly view

steps.action: For each day in the week, verify that all scheduled shifts are displayed with complete details
steps.expectedResult: Each shift shows start time, end time, location, and role for every scheduled day

steps.action: Identify and verify that weekend days (Saturday and Sunday) are visually highlighted or distinguished
steps.expectedResult: Weekend days are highlighted with different background color or visual indicator

steps.action: Locate the total hours summary section in the weekly view
steps.expectedResult: Total scheduled hours for the week is displayed prominently

steps.action: Manually calculate the total hours by summing all shift durations across the week
steps.expectedResult: Manual calculation produces a total hours value

steps.action: Compare the manually calculated total hours with the system-displayed total hours
steps.expectedResult: System-displayed total hours matches the manually calculated total exactly

steps.action: Cross-reference all displayed shift details with backend data from EmployeeSchedules table
steps.expectedResult: All shift times, locations, roles, and total hours match backend database records with 100% accuracy

steps.action: Measure and record the page load time from clicking 'Weekly View' to full display of all shifts
steps.expectedResult: Weekly schedule loads and displays completely within 3 seconds

postconditions: Employee remains logged in to the system
Weekly schedule view remains accessible
No errors are logged in the system
Employee can navigate to other weeks or views

testCases.title: Verify week navigation functionality
preconditions: Employee is logged into the web portal
Weekly schedule view is currently displayed
Employee has shifts scheduled in multiple weeks (past, current, and future)
Navigation buttons (Next Week, Previous Week) are visible on the interface

steps.action: Note the current week date range displayed in the weekly schedule header
steps.expectedResult: Current week date range is clearly visible (e.g., 'Week of Jan 15 - Jan 21, 2024')

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Next Week' button on the weekly schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view refreshes and displays the schedule for the next calendar week

steps.action: Verify the week date range in the header updates to show the next week's dates
steps.expectedResult: Header displays the next week's date range (e.g., 'Week of Jan 22 - Jan 28, 2024')

steps.action: Review all shifts displayed for the next week and verify they correspond to the correct week
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts fall within the next week's date range with accurate details

steps.action: Verify the total hours calculation updates to reflect the next week's scheduled hours
steps.expectedResult: Total hours displayed matches the sum of all shifts in the next week

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Previous Week' button on the weekly schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule view refreshes and displays the schedule for the previous calendar week (returning to original week)

steps.action: Verify the week date range in the header updates to show the previous week's dates
steps.expectedResult: Header displays the previous week's date range, matching the original week viewed

steps.action: Review all shifts displayed for the previous week and verify accuracy
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts match the original week's schedule with correct details

steps.action: Click 'Previous Week' button multiple times to navigate to earlier weeks
steps.expectedResult: Each click navigates backward one week, updating the date range and displaying appropriate shifts

steps.action: Click 'Next Week' button multiple times to navigate to future weeks
steps.expectedResult: Each click navigates forward one week, updating the date range and displaying appropriate shifts

steps.action: Verify that navigation to weeks with no scheduled shifts displays appropriate message
steps.expectedResult: Weeks with no shifts show 'No shifts scheduled for this week' or similar message

steps.action: Verify that each navigation action completes without errors and within acceptable time
steps.expectedResult: All week navigation transitions occur smoothly within 3 seconds per action, with no errors

postconditions: Employee remains on the weekly schedule view
Navigation buttons remain functional for continued use
No system errors are generated
Employee can continue navigating to any week

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized access is prevented
preconditions: Two employee accounts exist in the system (Employee A and Employee B)
Employee A is logged into the web portal
Employee B has scheduled shifts for the current week
Direct URL format for weekly schedules is known (e.g., /schedules/weekly?employeeId=B&weekStart=2024-01-15)
OAuth2 authentication and RBAC security controls are active

steps.action: While logged in as Employee A, construct the direct URL for Employee B's weekly schedule using Employee B's identifier
steps.expectedResult: URL is properly formatted with Employee B's employee ID and a valid week start date

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's weekly schedule by entering the constructed URL directly in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: System blocks access and displays an error message such as 'Access Denied: You are not authorized to view this schedule'

steps.action: Verify that Employee A is redirected to their own weekly schedule or an error page
steps.expectedResult: Employee A is redirected away from Employee B's schedule to either their own schedule or a generic access denied page

steps.action: Verify that no schedule data belonging to Employee B is displayed in the browser
steps.expectedResult: No shifts, hours, locations, roles, or any data belonging to Employee B is visible on the screen

steps.action: Check the browser network tab or developer tools for any API responses
steps.expectedResult: No API responses contain Employee B's schedule data; only error responses are present

steps.action: Attempt to access Employee B's weekly schedule using the API endpoint directly with Employee A's authentication token (e.g., GET /api/schedules/weekly?employeeId=B&weekStart=2024-01-15)
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized HTTP status code with error message in response body

steps.action: Verify the API error response contains appropriate security message without leaking system information
steps.expectedResult: Error message is generic (e.g., 'Access denied') without revealing internal system details or confirming Employee B's existence

steps.action: Verify that Employee A's session remains active and they can still access their own weekly schedule
steps.expectedResult: Employee A can navigate back to their own weekly schedule without re-authentication

postconditions: Employee A remains logged in with access only to their own schedule
Employee B's schedule data remains completely secure and inaccessible
Security controls continue to function properly
No data breach or unauthorized access occurred

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my monthly schedule to plan long-term commitments

testCases.title: Validate monthly schedule display with accurate shifts
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has assigned shifts in the EmployeeSchedules table for the current month
System is accessible and operational
Browser is supported (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the employee portal login page and enter valid employee credentials (username and password), then click the 'Login' button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard. Dashboard displays employee name and navigation menu including 'Schedule' option

steps.action: Click on the 'Schedule' section from the navigation menu and select 'Monthly View' option
steps.expectedResult: Monthly schedule view is displayed showing the current month's calendar. All assigned shifts for the logged-in employee are visible with dates, times, and shift types. Weekends and holidays are highlighted. Navigation controls for previous/next months are present

steps.action: Review each shift entry displayed on the calendar and verify shift details (date, start time, end time, shift type). Check the summary section for total hours per week and total hours for the month
steps.expectedResult: All shift details match the expected schedule data from the EmployeeSchedules table. Total hours per week are calculated correctly by summing all shift hours within each week. Total monthly hours are calculated correctly by summing all shift hours for the month. Calculations are accurate with no discrepancies

postconditions: Employee remains logged in to the system
Monthly schedule view remains displayed
No data has been modified in the system
Session is active and valid

testCases.title: Verify month navigation functionality
preconditions: Employee is logged into the portal
Monthly schedule view is currently displayed showing the current month
Employee has shifts scheduled in previous and/or next months
System has schedule data available for multiple months

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Next Month' button or navigation control on the monthly schedule view
steps.expectedResult: The calendar view transitions to display the next month's schedule. The month and year header updates to show the correct next month. All shifts assigned to the employee for that month are displayed accurately. Total hours summary updates to reflect the new month's data. Page loads without errors or delays

steps.action: Locate and click the 'Previous Month' button or navigation control on the monthly schedule view
steps.expectedResult: The calendar view transitions back to display the previous month's schedule (returning to the original current month). The month and year header updates to show the correct previous month. All shifts assigned to the employee for that month are displayed accurately. Total hours summary updates to reflect the month's data. Navigation is smooth without errors

steps.action: Continue clicking 'Previous Month' button multiple times to navigate to months in the past
steps.expectedResult: Each click successfully navigates to the previous month. Historical schedule data is displayed correctly for each month. System handles navigation without performance degradation or errors

steps.action: Click 'Next Month' button multiple times to navigate forward through months
steps.expectedResult: Each click successfully navigates to the next month. Future schedule data (if available) is displayed correctly. System handles forward navigation without errors

postconditions: Employee can navigate freely between months
Monthly schedule view remains functional
No errors are logged in the system
Employee session remains active

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized access is prevented
preconditions: Employee is logged into the portal with valid credentials
Another employee account exists in the system with a different employee ID
OAuth2 and RBAC security mechanisms are enabled and configured
API endpoint GET /api/schedules/monthly requires employee identity verification

steps.action: Attempt to manually modify the API request URL or parameters to access another employee's monthly schedule by changing the employee ID parameter (e.g., modify URL to include a different employee ID or manipulate browser developer tools to alter the request)
steps.expectedResult: System detects unauthorized access attempt. Access is denied immediately. An error message is displayed stating 'Access Denied: You are not authorized to view this schedule' or similar security message. HTTP 403 Forbidden status code is returned. No schedule data from the other employee is displayed or accessible

steps.action: Verify that the system logs the unauthorized access attempt and that the current employee's session remains valid
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized access attempt is logged in the system security logs with timestamp and employee ID. Current employee can still access their own monthly schedule without issues. Session is not terminated due to the failed access attempt

steps.action: Attempt to use API testing tools (like Postman or curl) to directly call GET /api/schedules/monthly with another employee's ID while using the current employee's authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden or HTTP 401 Unauthorized response. Response body contains error message indicating insufficient permissions. No schedule data is returned in the response payload

postconditions: Employee's own schedule access remains unaffected
Security violation is logged in the system
No unauthorized data was exposed
Employee session remains active and valid

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to filter my schedule by shift type to focus on specific work assignments

testCases.title: Validate shift type filtering functionality
preconditions: Employee is logged into the portal with valid credentials
Employee has multiple shifts assigned with different shift types (morning, evening, night)
Schedule view is accessible and displays the full schedule
Filter controls are visible and functional in the schedule interface
System has shift type data properly configured in EmployeeSchedules table

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule view section from the dashboard or main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Full schedule is displayed showing all assigned shifts for the employee. All shift types (morning, evening, night) are visible in the schedule. Filter options panel or dropdown is visible with available shift type options. Total count of shifts is displayed

steps.action: Locate the shift type filter control and select 'Evening' from the available shift type filter options
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied dynamically without page reload. Only shifts with shift type 'Evening' are displayed in the schedule view. All morning and night shifts are hidden from view. The schedule updates within 2 seconds. Total hours summary updates to reflect only evening shift hours. Filter indicator shows 'Evening' filter is active

steps.action: Verify that all displayed shifts are indeed evening shifts by checking shift times and shift type labels
steps.expectedResult: All visible shifts have 'Evening' shift type designation. Shift times correspond to evening hours as defined in the system. No morning or night shifts are present in the filtered view. Count of displayed shifts matches the expected number of evening shifts

steps.action: Click the 'Clear Filter' button or remove the active filter selection
steps.expectedResult: Filter is removed immediately. Full schedule is restored showing all shift types (morning, evening, night). All previously hidden shifts are now visible again. Total hours summary returns to showing all shifts. Filter indicator shows no active filters. Schedule displays the complete original view

postconditions: Schedule view returns to unfiltered state showing all shifts
Filter controls remain available for future use
No data has been modified in the system
Employee session remains active

testCases.title: Ensure filtering respects employee identity
preconditions: Employee is logged into the portal with valid credentials and authentication token
Another employee account exists in the system with different employee ID
API endpoint GET /api/schedules with filter parameters requires employee identity validation
Security mechanisms (OAuth2, RBAC) are properly configured
API testing tool (Postman, curl, or browser developer tools) is available

steps.action: Using API testing tools or browser developer tools, construct a GET request to /api/schedules endpoint with filter parameters for shift type, but modify the employee ID parameter to target another employee's shifts while using the current employee's authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API request is sent with manipulated employee ID parameter. System validates the authentication token against the requested employee ID. Mismatch is detected between authenticated employee and requested employee data

steps.action: Observe and verify the API response status code and response body
steps.expectedResult: API returns HTTP 403 Forbidden or HTTP 401 Unauthorized status code. Response body contains error message such as 'Access Denied' or 'Unauthorized access to employee data'. No schedule data is returned in the response payload. Response does not contain any shifts belonging to the other employee

steps.action: Attempt the same unauthorized access through the UI by manipulating browser session storage, cookies, or URL parameters to request another employee's filtered schedule
steps.expectedResult: UI prevents unauthorized access. Error message is displayed to the user. No schedule data from another employee is rendered. Current employee's own schedule remains accessible. Security event is logged in the system

steps.action: Verify that the current employee can still successfully filter their own schedule after the failed unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Employee's own schedule filtering functionality works normally. Filters can be applied and cleared without issues. Only the authenticated employee's shifts are displayed when filters are applied. System performance is not affected by the previous unauthorized access attempt

postconditions: No unauthorized data was accessed or exposed
Security violation is logged in system audit logs
Employee's own schedule access remains functional
Authentication and authorization mechanisms remain intact
Employee session is still valid

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to search my schedule by date to quickly find specific shifts

testCases.title: Validate successful date search
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system
Employee has access to the schedule section
Employee has at least one scheduled shift in the database
Test data includes dates with shifts and dates without shifts
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule section from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule section loads successfully and displays the date search input field

steps.action: Locate the date search input field on the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Date search input field is visible and enabled for input

steps.action: Enter a valid date (e.g., 2024-03-15) that has scheduled shifts in the date search field
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and displayed in the correct format in the input field

steps.action: Click the search button or press Enter to execute the search
steps.expectedResult: Search results load within 2 seconds and display all shifts scheduled for the entered date with shift time, location, and role information

steps.action: Verify that only shifts for the searched date are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All displayed shifts match the searched date and no other dates are shown

steps.action: Clear the search field or click a clear/reset button
steps.expectedResult: Search field is cleared and full schedule view is restored

steps.action: Enter a valid date (e.g., 2024-04-20) that has no scheduled shifts in the date search field
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and displayed in the correct format in the input field

steps.action: Click the search button or press Enter to execute the search
steps.expectedResult: Search completes within 2 seconds and displays 'No shifts found' message for the entered date

steps.action: Verify that no shift data is displayed and the message is clear and user-friendly
steps.expectedResult: 'No shifts found' message is prominently displayed with no shift records shown

steps.action: Enter an invalid date format (e.g., '32/13/2024', 'abc123', '2024-13-45') in the date search field
steps.expectedResult: System detects invalid format immediately

steps.action: Attempt to execute the search with the invalid date format
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed indicating invalid date format with guidance on correct format (e.g., 'Please enter date in YYYY-MM-DD format')

steps.action: Verify that no search is executed and no shift data is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Search is not executed, error message remains visible, and schedule view remains unchanged

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule section remains accessible
Search functionality is ready for next search
No data has been modified in the system
Full schedule view can be restored by clearing search
